org.cfpm.factbaseExtension
Class FactBaseNOf

java.lang.Object
  org.nlogo.api.DefaultReporter
      org.cfpm.factbaseExtension.FactBaseNOf
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.nlogo.api.Primitive, org.nlogo.api.Reporter, scala.ScalaObject
public class FactBaseNOf
extends org.nlogo.api.DefaultReporter

This class implements the "n-of" primitive for the factbase extension. N-of retrieves n random facts satisfying the specified condition from the given fact base. It is an error if n is greater than the number of such facts. To call this primitive from NetLogo, use factbase:n-of fact-base condition-task condition-field-list number

Author:
Ruth Meyer

Method Detail

getSyntax

public org.nlogo.api.Syntax getSyntax()
The n-of primitive expects a fact base, a condition (specified as a reporter task and a list of corresponding fields) and an integer number (number of facts wanted) as inputs and returns a list of n facts satisfying the given condition.

Specified by:
getSyntax in interface org.nlogo.api.Primitive
Overrides:
getSyntax in class org.nlogo.api.DefaultReporter

report

public java.lang.Object report(org.nlogo.api.Argument[] args,
                               org.nlogo.api.Context context)
                        throws org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException,
                               org.nlogo.api.LogoException
Returns n random facts satisfying the given condition from the specified fact base. The first argument args[0] has to be a fact base, the second argument args[1] has to be a reporter task, the third argument has to be a list of field names corresponding to the formal arguments used in the task, and the fourth argument has to be an integer number. Generates an error if n > number of possible facts.

Parameters:
args - the arguments to this call of n-of
context - the NetLogo context
Returns:
list of n random facts satisfying the given condition
Throws:
org.nlogo.api.ExtensionException
org.nlogo.api.LogoException
See Also:
Reporter.report(org.nlogo.api.Argument[], org.nlogo.api.Context)
